title: `zcash_primitives 0.11.0`, `zcash_proofs 0.11.0`, `zcash_client_backend 0.8.0`, `zcash_client_sqlite 0.6.0`
body: Closes #765.

title: Use proptest instead of quickcheck for zcash_history tests.
body:
Part of #757; resolves duplicate `rand-core` dependencies.

Best viewed ignoring whitespace changes.

title: zcash_primitives: Downgrade to `bip0039 0.10`
body: `bip0039 0.11` switched from language function arguments to a generic parameter. We aren't ready to migrate to this yet.

title: Add roundtrip and golden tests for v1 `MerkleBridge` serialization.
Fix double-entry accounting errors in transaction views.
Ensure that Sapling padding outputs are taken account in ZIP 317 change computation.
body: Fixes #799

title: Fix a theoretical possibility of overflow leading to panic
body: Closes https://github.com/zcash/librustzcash/issues/786 by changing the type of `byte_count` from `usize` to `u64`.

title: Upgrade to redjubjub 0.7.0
body:
This removes our reliance on the following out-of-date transitive dependencies that are duplicative of more recent versions of crates we depend on:
- bls12_381 v0.7
- ff v0.12
- group v0.12
- jubjub v0.9
- pasta_curves v0.4
- reddsa v0.3

title: zcash_note_encryption: remove `recipient` parameter from `Domain::note_plaintext_bytes`
body: This then updates the `zcash_note_encryption` crate for a version 0.3.0 release.

title: Update dependencies to reflect changes in ff 0.13
[#792] zcash_primitives: implement Seed Signature section of ZIP-32
body:
Implements a type to enclose a Seed Fingerprint byte sequence called `SeedFingerprint`

implements a public function to create a `SeedFingerprint` from seed bytes

Closes #792

v3.2.5

Sourced from actions/cache's changelog.

3.2.4

3.2.5

3.2.6

3.3.0

  • Added option to lookup cache without downloading it.

3.3.1

  • Reduced segment size to 128MB and segment timeout to 10 minutes to fail fast in case the cache download is stuck.

title: Temporarily re-expose ability to construct invalid Sapling bundles
body: Until zcash/zcash#6397 is closed, this ability is needed by `zcashd` for crossing the FFI.

title: Pin the `inferno` transitive dependency to avoid MSRV errors.
CI: Replace `actions-rs/toolchain` with `dtolnay/rust-toolchain`
body: Now that dtolnay/rust-toolchain#53 has been closed, we can migrate away from the unmaintained actions-rs/toolchain.

title: CI: Replace most unmaintained `actions-rs/*` actions
body:
The `actions-rs/*` actions are unmaintained. See actions-rs/toolchain#216 for more information.

- `actions-rs/toolchain` is replaced by `rust-toolchain.toml`.
- `actions-rs/cargo` is replaced by direct cargo usage.
- `actions-rs/tarpaulin` is replaced by the `cargo-tarpaulin` container.

We currently retain a few usages due to a current lack of alternatives:

- `actions-rs/toolchain` to enable beta (for Clippy warnings) and nightly (for building the book).
- `actions-rs/clippy-check` so Clippy results are published as annotations on PRs.

We also now require via `rust-toolchain.toml` that people building from the repo have the `clippy` and `rustfmt` components installed. This is fine because they will need to ensure these pass when making PRs.

title: `zcash_primitives 0.10.0`, `zcash_proofs 0.10.0`, `zcash_client_backend 0.7.0`, `zcash_client_sqlite 0.5.0`
body:
Closes #764.
Closes #719.

title: Remove unstable function `WalletWrite::remove_unmined_tx`
body:
Closes #622 (if the decision is to actually remove this)

Used PR https://github.com/zcash/librustzcash/pull/621 as reference to know what had been added and remove it.

title: Add a note about metadata database initialization to `FsBlockDb::for_path`
body: Fixes #748

title: Factor out a transaction proposal API from `spend`.

labels.name: S-waiting-on-review
labels.description: Status: Awaiting review from the assignee but also interested parties.

body:
This change makes it possible for wallets using the `zcash_client_backend::data_api::wallet` module to perform transaction preparation, including input selection and fee calculation, as an independent step prior to creating proofs and signatures. This can be used to improve user experience by making it possible to report the proposed effects of the transaction to the wallet user (including privacy implications) prior to authorizing the transaction.

Closes #716.

title: Bump MSRV for `zcash_primitives` and dependents to 1.60
body:
The MSRVs of the component crates are left as-is, partly because our dependencies don't require us to bump them, and partly because those crates have no pending changes and are relatively stable. We also plan to split the component crates out into a separate repository, where it will be easier to have a separate MSRV.

Closes zcash/librustzcash#759.

title: [#751] add support for rewind_to_height to FsBlockDb
body: Closes #751

title: Sapling API changes
body: Closes #454.

title: Sapling refactor
body: This refactors the internals of the `zcash_primitives::sapling` module. It does not alter the existing public API (which is being done in #755).

title: Implement fmt::Display descriptions for FsBlockDbError
body:
Closes #742

This is mainly for FFI Display

title: Improve Sapling type safety
body:
Closes #739.
Closes #740.

title: Add `shielding_threshold` argument to `shield_transparent_funds`.
body:
Previously, the shielding threshold was fixed to 100000 zatoshis.

Fixes #726

title: Fix transparent balance error when the wallet is empty.
body: Fixes #724

title: We now pad sapling outputs to two with at least one input for fee calculation
Parse ZIP 321 URIs without query parameters
body: Fixes #707.

title: Adds `limit` parameter to `validate_chain()`
body:
Closes zcash/librustzcash#705

This change adds a `limit` parameter to `validate_chain()` function and also makes the `validate_from` parameters non-optional to avoid falling back to `sapling_activation_height` which is an implicit default parameter that is visible to the caller and I consider it hurts the "locality" of the function itself. 

I have empirical reasons to suspect that these assumptions on DB state don’t hold up and it can trigger a DB rewind on clients using validate_chain without specifying a concrete `validate_from` value and that might make the clients delete the whole database.

If you pass None to the validate_from  parameter to a BlockSourceT that has blocks on it and does not start in sapling_activation  this will fail with a weird state that would signal a gap of sapling_activation_height - 1 and first_existing_block_in_block_source regardless of it’s valid state.

I might have seen this bug in action in debug environments.

I also cleaned up the side-effects of the Optional `validate_from` parameter which results in the removal of the `ParamsT` argument since it's no longer needed because there is no more fallback to `sapling_activation_height`  when no value is provided. The `if () else` structure resulting of this change as been simplified as well. 

I only have one doubt I'd like to run by @str4d and @nuttycom:  Is it possible that there's no `prev_hash` to be provided?

title: Update generated protobufs
body: `prost 0.11.2` added code formatting support, so the generated files now better match what rustfmt produces.

title: Release `zcash_client_sqlite 0.4.0` and dependencies
body:
Closes #487.
Closes #488.
Closes #497.

title: Add missing `std::fmt::Display` implementations for error types.
Spend internal Sapling notes with the internal Sapling spending key.
Fix clippy complaints about generated protobuf code.
body: Clippy currently fails on all PRs based on `main` due to linter errors in the generated protobuf code.

title: Add ZIP 317 fee calculation strategy.
body: This builds atop #689

title: Fix a bug in migrations when transaction block height is unknown.
body: Un-mined transactions cannot currently be migrated to retroactively store fee information, because the encoding used to persist them is unknown.

title: zcash_client_backend: Switch from `protobuf 2` to `prost 0.11`
body: The latter is maintained by the Tokio developers, and has easy integration with the `tonic` gRPC library which is actively maintained.

title: Add dynamic note selection that is responsive to changes in required fees.
body: This PR is best reviewed hiding whitespace changes.

title: Correctly construct outputs when spending internal notes.
body: This builds atop #658

title: get_transparent_balances fails with `no such column`
body:
Error message:

"Error while fetching transparent balances for AccountId(0): no such column: u.received_by_accountt"

Closes #686

title: Allow insertion of UTXOs associated with the legacy taddr.
body: The legacy transparent address is never added to the `addresses` table, but we still need to be able to receive UTXOs sent to that address. So, we add a special case for when a UTXO matches that legacy address, and set the account ID to 0 manually.

title: Bump versions for zcash_address, zcash_encoding and zcash_history crates
body: This bumps `zcash_address` and `zcash_encoding` versions to 0.2. Then, it bumps `zcash_primitives` to `0.8.1` (which now depend on the new versions of `zcash_address` and `zcash_encoding`) with the goal to yank `0.8.0` which was mistakenly published prior to the version bumps of `zcash_address` and `zcash_encoding`.

title: This reverts a previous incorrect change to the changelog.
body: The MSRV bump was actually in `zcash_history` 0.3.0, even though the addition of that to the Cargo.toml file was post-0.3.0 release.

title: Update zcash_primitives to orchard 0.3; release zcash_primitives and zcash_proofs 0.8.
body:
* This updates the `zcash_primitives` crate to use `orchard 0.3` which is a breaking change; we do a release of `zcash_primitives 0.8`.
* We update `zcash_proofs` to use `zcash_primitives 0.8` which is a breaking change; we do a release of `zcash_proofs 0.8`.
* We update `zcash_extensions`, `zcash_client_backend`, `zcash_client_sqlite` to use `zcash_primitives 0.8` which is a breaking change; we are not releasing these crates in this PR.
* We also update `zcash_client_backend` to use `orchard 0.3`.

title: zcash_client_backend: Fix missing bound
body: In 47a0d0d2b789c816525aa1d07c0ebbfd67758cf1 `WalletWriteTransparent` was merged into `WalletWrite`, including its associated type `UtxoRef`. However, `shield_transparent_funds` placed a bound on this associated type that was not moved to `WalletWrite`. This left the generic parameter `U` unconstrained, which didn't cause a local failure because the method has no local tests, but was immediately apparent when trying to use the method in the mobile SDKs.

title: Mark our utxos spent when we detect them as inputs to a transaction.
body:
This modifies `decrypt_and_store_transaction` to check for inputs
to a transaction being decrypted that correspond to addresses in
our wallet. For each such UTXO found, it is marked spent in our
`utxos` table if present.

title: Remove the `WalletReadTransparent` and `WalletWriteTransparent` extension traits.
body: These traits introduce a problem, in that constraints on a method cannot be conditionally required based upon the presence or absence of a feature flag. Instead, we make the methods previously introduced by the removed traits present in all cases on the `WalletRead` and `WalletWrite` traits, but ensure that their implementations return an error if the caller attempts to use them in a wallet that has not been configured with support for transparent inputs functionality.

title: Remove unused dependencies
body: These were mostly detected with `cargo-udeps`, for which I've also added exclusions for the dependencies it can't detect are used in doc-tests.

title: Remove `received_by_account` field from WalletTransparentOutput
body:
Due to how the wallets retrieved unspent transparent outputs from the light wallet server, the account associated with a particular UTXO may not be known by the light wallet. Instead of requiring the caller to perform a separate lookup and match the address of the received UTXO with a known account, it's simpler to perform this lookup internally at the time of insertion or update.

In order to make this operation more efficient, the `addresses_table` migration is modified to add a column containing the transparent receiver so that they may be used in the joins in the UTXO insert and update operations.

title: Allow spent UTXOs to be absent in migrations when adding tx fee.
body: The previous approach to UTXO handling involved UTXO data being deleted from the wallet after the relevant UTXOs had been spent. However, this means that we can no longer accurately compute transaction fees for the transactions spending those UTXOs. However, since the transaction fee has been a constant 1000 ZAT for the life of any wallet where this issue might occur, we can just ignore those cases and assume the 1000 ZAT fee.

title: zcash_proofs: Temporarily fix params download
body:
The implementation of `io:Read` for `ResponseLazyReader` used to return
only one byte regardless of the size of the provided `buf`, which
degraded the performance of loading the response.

This change makes use of the provided `buf`. On my machine with Rust
1.64, the downloading speed went up from ~100 KiB/s to ~2 MiB/s.
However, as before this change, the process still uses 100% of a single
CPU thread when downloading the response. The most likely reason is that
we still manually read each byte of the response. I can download the
same data with ~ 50 MiB/s on my machine using a different HTTP client.

This fix seems to be sufficient for now.

title: Add more information to v_transactions, v_sent_tx, and v_received_tx
body: This adds sent and received note count information, transaction fees, account information, and makes the information returned about sent notes and received notes consistent with one another.

title: Fix Sapling key organization.
body: This change moves Sapling-specific key generation into a submodule of `zip32`. Public reexports are used to keep the existing API consistent.

title: Use unified spending keys for spends & shielding.
body: Fixes #616

title: Track inputs sent to wallet-internal recipients
body: This adds trial decryption with the internal IVK and correctly tracks payments sent to the wallet-internal address in the wallet database.

title: Update the transaction builder to make change outputs explicit
body: This introduces a FeeStrategy abstraction (and `FutureFeeStrategy` for `zfuture`) that can be used to compute fees and required change during the process of transaction build. This also modifies `TransactionBuilder` to require the caller to construct a change output directly, instead of doing so implicitly.

title: Use upsert functionality for transparent UTXOs, rather than delete/repopulate.
body:
The ios FFI was still relying upon a deprecated approach to handling transparent UTXOs, deleting
all of them above a certain height and repopulating them each time they were retrieved. Now, instead,
the `put_received_transparent_utxo` data access API method actually performs a proper upsert, so
there should be no need for the clear function.

This builds on #656

title: Move wallet migrations into individual modules.
zcash_client_sqlite: fix wallet::get_max_account_id
body: This had the same bug as was fixed in 5b8ec380a006ccc0ccb38c11cc6832e1176015c0

title: `zcash_client_backend`: Refactor tracking of `BatchRunner` heap memory usage
body:
The new approach now correctly measures the heap usage of the precomputed IVKs used for Sapling as of #633. It also fixes several bugs that resulted in undercounting.

Depends on https://github.com/zkcrypto/group/pull/37.

title: Update chacha20poly1305 dependency in zcash_primitives to 0.10
body: This makes it consistent with zcash_note_encryption. fixes #650

title: Batch scanner memory reduction
body: Ported from https://github.com/zcash/zcash/pull/6172.

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. title: Update unified address test vectors
body:
This updates unified address test vectors after
https://github.com/zcash-hackworks/zcash-test-vectors/pull/89 to check addresses across multiple diversifier indices, and also removes the superfluous binary encoding of UA strings.

title: Fix problems identified by clippy's beta lints
zcash_client_sqlite: Fix `FsBlockDb::get_max_cached_height`
body: The `MAX` SQLite function returns `null` when the table is empty. The code was expecting zero rows to be returned in this case, and was trying to parse the `null` as an integer.

title: zcash_client_backend: Add gRPC bindings behind feature flag
body:
The lightwalletd service file is sourced from zcash/lightwalletd@ad5ecda5fbb5e12799f926b8cd785d54fdd250c8

Closes zcash/librustzcash#585.

title: CI: Migrate to `cargo-tarpaulin` branch with LLVM source coverage engine
body: This deploys https://github.com/xd009642/tarpaulin/pull/940 for (hopefully) improved coverage information.

title: zcash_client_backend: Add tags to IVKs in the batch scanner
body:
This removes the dependency on `SaplingIvk::to_repr()`, and enables us to alter the type of `D::IncomingViewingKey` to improve the performance of batch scanning.

For the welding rig, we already annotate the viewing keys with `AccountId`, so we use `(AccountId, Scope)` as the tag.

title: Add APIs to prepare ivk and epk and implement them for Sapling
